items.title: Sarkozy says he will ‘sleep in jail but with head held high’ after conviction
bullets: • First time a former head of state has been sent to prison in modern French history

• Sentence follows trial in which he and his aides were accused of making a corruption pact with the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi to receive funding for the 2007 French presidential election campaign

items.title: Heisenberg said it was impossible. Scientists just proved otherwise
bullets: • Researchers have reimagined Heisenberg’s uncertainty principle, engineering a trade-off that allows precise measurement of both position and momentum
• Using quantum computing tools like grid states and trapped ions, they demonstrated sensing precision beyond classical limits
• Such advances could revolutionize navigation, medicine, and physics

items.title: Namibia deploys army to fight wildfire burning third of Etosha game reserve
bullets: • Namibia has begun deploying hundreds of soldiers to fight a fire that has burned through a third of Etosha national park
• The park in the north of the largely desert country is home to 114 species of mammals, notably the critically endangered black rhinoceros
• The fire had been burning since 22 September and had caused extensive ecological damage

items.title: 30 years later, I’m still obliterating planets in Master of Orion II—and you can, too
bullets: • Master of Orion II (MOO2) is a game that has you develop and build up planets across a simple galaxy map
• The deeper and longer the experience, the better the payoff can be
• The games I love the most are the ones where you make decisions that compound over many hours to a long-term payoff

items.title: 150 million-year-old pterosaur cold case has finally been solved
bullets: • Pterodactylus antiquus hatchlings were found in the Solnhofen Limestones of Germany
• Their bones showed how they had succumbed to storm winds
• Unable to fly, they drowned and were rapidly buried in the lagoon depths

items.title: The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret
bullets: • Barches of barrel cactus have been chopped up and seeped in vats of sugar until they're crystalized
• The Mexican government began banning the sale of acitrón in the early 2000s
• The biznaga cactus was found to be in danger of extinction due to overexploitation

items.title: Meet the woman steering Biden's bipartisan winning streak on Capitol Hill
bullets: • The White House has a long list of issues facing the nation's first two years of Congress
• President Barack Obama and his staff are working on a bipartisan agenda
• They say it's important to keep the public eye on what's happening in the U.S

items.title: NoViolet Bulawayo wins the Best of Caine award
bullets: • Best of Caine Prize for African Writing is awarded for a short story
• The story examines the lives of a group of children in Budapest, Hungary
• The winner of the award will be announced at the end of the month
• The award was handed out at the British Library in London today

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda expected to batter parts of the southeastern U.S. this week
bullets: • Parts of the U.S
• are expected to be hit by Tropical Storm I-Bahamas
• The storm is expected to bring heavy rain to parts of the country
• Parts of South Carolina, Florida and Georgia are in the path of the storm
• The hurricane is a tropical depression

items.title: ‘A donkey cart out of El Fasher costs more than a new car’: how 500 days under siege is tearing the city apart
bullets: • El Fasher, North Darfur’s capital, has been trapped in one of the longest urban sieges of modern warfare
• The siege, progressively tightened by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF), has transformed the city
• Civilians move block by block in search of safety, while self-defence groups fight alongside entrenched garrisons

items.title: Is taking acetaminophen during pregnancy really associated with autism in children?
bullets: • President Trump suggested that taking acetaminophen during pregnancy is linked to autism in children
• Doctors disagree and say there's no strong evidence for that
• Tylenol could play a role in ongoing legal cases against the company that makes it
• NPR's pharmaceuticals correspondent, Sydney Lupkin, joins us in the comments

items.title: Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite'
bullets: • Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite' The rocks that hurtle from outer space and make it to Earth get a moment to shine
• At the Cincinnati Observatory later today, collectors will be showing off some of their treasures

items.title: How Kyrsten Sinema's decision makes Democrats' 2024 Senate map tighter
bullets: • Arizona Sen
• Kyrsten Sinema has always been a thorn in the Democrats side during her time in Congress
• She voted against her party more than almost any other member of Congress
• Now, the Democratic caucus has 48 Democrats and three independents

items.title: EA going private in $55 billion deal that will pay shareholders $210 a share
bullets: • The Public Investment Fund of Saudi Arabia, Silver Lake and Affinity Partners will buy EA in an all-cash deal worth $55 billion
• Shareholders will receive $210 per share in cash
• The deal is set to be the largest leveraged buyout in Wall Street history

items.title: Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu to discuss Gaza peace plan at the White House – US politics live
bullets: • Donald Trump will try to close the gap with an isolated Benjamin Netanyahu, two senior administration officials have told Politico
• ‘Bibi is on his own island
• Not just from us, from his own government,” said one of the officials

items.title: Tensions expected as Trump meets with top Democrats and Republicans in effort to avoid shutdown
bullets: • Meeting aimed at reaching an agreement over funding the government
• It hinges on Democrat demands for an extension of funding subsidies under Obamacare
• Failure likely to result in large swathes of the federal government shutting down from 1 October
• Trump and the Republicans have signaled that they are unfazed at that prospect, calculating that the public will blame Democrat intransigence

items.title: Medicare Advantage enrollment expected to fall in 2026 as insurers cut back on unprofitable plans
bullets: • Medicare Advantage enrollment is set to fall for the first time in nearly two decades
• The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services estimates that less than half of all seniors will be in the program in 2025
• Health insurers have faced shrinking profits in their Medicare Advantage programs over the last two years

items.title: Trump ‘Truths’ about tariffs on films and furniture raise questions on details
bullets: • President Donald Trump says he will impose a 100% tariff on foreign-made films
• He also says he'll impose "substantial Tariffs" on any country that does not make furniture in the United States
• Trump's statements leave key questions about the plans unanswered

items.title: Ice’s deportations of south-east Asian refugees creating ‘ripple effect’ of trauma: ‘I didn’t get to say bye to my husband’
bullets: • A man who was deported to Laos with only a license and $65 in cash has been unable to pay for his return to his native country
• He's been living in a refugee camp in Laos since the end of the Vietnam War
• The man's mother is raising money to send him back to Laos to help him find his family

items.title: Comcast names Mike Cavanagh as co-CEO alongside Brian Roberts
bullets: • Comcast named Mike Cavanagh as co-CEO alongside longtime leader Brian Roberts
• Roberts will remain as chairman and co-executive of the cable giant
• Before Comcast, he was CEO of JPMorgan's corporate and investment bank
• Comcast shares were essentially flat in early trading Monday following the announcement

items.title: Michigan car crash kills three family members from TLC’s Meet the Putmans
bullets: • Bill ‘Papa’ Putman, his wife, Barb – who goes by Neenee – and their daughter-in-law Megan were killed in a “tragic car accident” The family added that members identified as Uncle Blake, Lulu, Alena, Noah and Gia were also injured in the crash

items.title: Trump renews threat of imposing steep tariffs on films made outside the US
bullets: • Donald Trump renews threat of imposing steep tariffs on films made outside the United States
• Trump says other countries have taken business from the U.S
• 'Just like stealing candy from a baby', he writes in a Truth Social post
• He did not provide further details on his plans or a timeline for when these tariffs might be enacted

items.title: It’s official: EA is selling to private equity in $55 billion deal
bullets: • Electronic Arts announced plans to go private Monday morning
• Shareholders will receive $210 per share in the deal, a 25 percent premium on the $168.32 price for a share at the close of business last Thursday
• The Saudi Arabian PIF already owned 9.9 percent of EA's outstanding public stock and will roll-over that investment into this buyout

items.title: Death toll rises to four after Michigan church shooting and arson attack
bullets: • Four dead and eight injured after Michigan church shooting and arson attack
• Gunman drove a vehicle into the building and opened fire, setting it alight, police say
• Thomas Jacob Sanford, 40, was later shot dead by police in the building's car park
• Authorities are investigating the incident as an "act of targeted violence"

items.title: Cleveland Fed’s Hammack warns of 'challenging time' amid inflation worries
bullets: • Cleveland Federal Reserve President Hammack says the U.S
• central bank faces challenges

• Hammack: "We have been missing our mandate on the inflation side, for more than 4½ years" The Fed lowered its benchmark overnight lending rate by a quarter percentage point to a range of 4.00%-4.25% earlier this month

items.title: Big AI firms pump money into world models as LLM advances slow
bullets: • The world’s top artificial intelligence groups are stepping up their focus on so-called world models that can better understand human environments
• Google DeepMind, Meta, and Nvidia are developing systems that aim to navigate the physical world by learning from videos and robotic data rather than just language

items.title: ZR1, GTD, and America’s new Nürburgring war
bullets: • The Nürburgring is a 13-mile racetrack in western Germany
• It dates back to the 1920s and has hosted the German Grand Prix for a half-century
• The track's domestic profile has lately been on the rise

items.title: Trump to push new peace plan in talks with Netanyahu
bullets: • Trump to push new peace plan in talks with Netanyahu to end the Israel-Gaza war
• US President will push Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to accept the framework of the new plan
• It stipulates the release of all hostages within 48 hours of the deal being confirmed

items.title: Moldova's pro-EU party wins vote mired in claims of Russian interference
bullets: • Moldova's pro-EU party wins vote mired in claims of Russian interference
• Maia Sandu's Party of Action and Solidarity secured about 50% of the vote
• Opposition leader Igor Dodon had claimed victory even before results came in

items.title: Typhoon kills at least 11 as it sweeps through Vietnam
bullets: • Typhoon Bualoi has killed at least 11 people and damaged or destroyed hundreds of homes in the centre and north of Vietnam, state media reported
• Dozens are missing or injured after the typhoon made landfall on Sunday night, flooding roads, washing away bridges and tearing roofs off buildings
• Typhoon has already killed more than 20 people in the Philippines since Friday

items.title: Singapore denies entry to exiled HK pro-democracy activist
bullets: • Singapore denies entry to exiled Hong Kong pro-democracy activist
• Law is one of eight people accused of endangering national security
• Law was due to attend a "closed-door, invitation-only" conference in Singapore on Saturday
• Singapore has an extradition treaty with Hong Kong

items.title: 3 things to know about Trump's plan to send troops to Portland and Memphis
bullets: • President Trump has ordered troops to be deployed in Portland, Ore., and Memphis, Tenn
• He says he's authorized them to use "full force" to curb protests outside U.S
• Immigration and Customs facilities
• It's the latest instance of Trump sending troops to cities he says are plagued by crime

items.title: The latest on the Michigan church shooting. And, Trump's new plan to end war in Gaza
bullets: • The latest on the Michigan church shooting
• An unknown number of people are unaccounted for
• The gunman, 40-year-old Thomas Jacob Sanford, was killed after exchanging gunfire with two law enforcement officers
• Four top congressional leaders, two from each party, are scheduled to meet with President Trump today

items.title: Overseas Hong Kong pro-democracy activist Nathan Law denied entry to Singapore
bullets: • Hong Kong activist Nathan Law says he was denied entry to Singapore for what he presumes were political reasons
• Law is one of a number of Hong Kong activists who have left the city in recent years
• Hong Kong police have issued a warrant for Law's arrest under the city's National Security Law

items.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar talks about the potential for a government shutdown
bullets: • Sen
• Amy Klobuchar talks about the potential for a government shutdown September 29, 20256:26 AM ET Heard on Morning Edition on NPR's Morning Edition
• Listen to the full transcript of this week's episode of The Daily Discussion

items.title: Moldova's pro-EU party wins clear parliamentary majority, defeating pro-Russian groups
bullets: • Moldova's pro-EU party wins clear parliamentary majority, defeating pro-Russian groups
• Electoral data indicate the party will hold a clear majority of about 55 of the 101 seats in the legislature
• The election was widely viewed as a geopolitical choice: between a path to the European Union or a drift back into Moscow's fold

items.title: Scared of spiders? Some former arachnophobes now are keeping jumping spiders as pets
bullets: • Thousands of jumping spiders are being flooded with requests from people who want to keep them as pets
• Social media videos of the spiders' antics have been viewed millions of times on YouTube
• Some women are trying to overcome their fear of spiders, while others are simply enchanted by their unexpected cuteness

items.title: Top congressional leaders head to the White House ahead of shutdown deadline
bullets: • Top congressional leaders head to White House ahead of shutdown deadline
• Meeting with Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer, D-N.Y., House Speaker Mike Johnson, R-La., and House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries
• Meeting comes after President Trump canceled a planned meeting last week

items.title: Hubble finds a hybrid galaxy with a mysterious and violent past
bullets: • Hubble finds a hybrid galaxy with a mysterious and violent past
• NGC 2775 lies 67 million light-years away in the constellation Cancer (The Crab) Blending features of spirals, ellipticals, and lenticulars, its structure may be the result of past galactic mergers

items.title: Earth was born dry until a cosmic collision made it a blue planet
bullets: • Earth was born dry until a cosmic collision made it a blue planet
• Initially, the planet was barren and inhospitable, missing water and carbon compounds
• A colossal collision with Theia likely changed everything, bringing the essential ingredients for life
• Study highlights that habitability may hinge on rare chance events

items.title: Black hole discovery confirms Einstein and Hawking were right
bullets: • New observations of a merger of two black holes confirm decades-old predictions by Albert Einstein, Stephen Hawking and Roy Kerr
• Scientists tracked the complete cosmic collision, confirming that black holes are defined by mass and spin
• They also gained stronger proof that a black hole’s event horizon only grows, echoing thermodynamic laws

items.title: Fossils in germany reveal a Jurassic sea monster with a swordfish snout
bullets: • Fossils in germany reveal a Jurassic sea monster with a swordfish snout
• Discovery underscores Mistelgau’s global significance as a Jurassic fossil site
• The marine reptile had a dramatic overbite similar to swordfish and unique skeletal traits that set it apart from other species

items.title: World must deny Israel ‘tools of genocide’, says growing alliance of activist states
bullets: • Malaysian foreign minister Mohamad Hasan said the international community has a legal and moral duty to deny Israel ‘the tools of genocide’ The Hague Group is a growing alliance of countries dedicated to coordinating practical economic and legal steps to isolate Israel over the war in Gaza

items.title: Alexa Plus is smarter — but it’s not yet smart enough
bullets: • This week, Amazon will launch new hardware to supercharge Alexa Plus
• Alexa Plus is a hybrid smart home assistant and personal assistant
• The assistant needs something to make it more compelling, and better hardware could be the answer
• The new hardware could make the smart home more accessible to users

items.title: Amazon’s kid-friendly Kindles are cheaper than ever ahead of October Prime Day
bullets: • Amazon’s October Prime Day (officially called Prime Big Deal Days) starts on October 7th
• Amazon has already discounted the Kindle Kids, Kindle Paperwhite Kids, and Kindle Colorsoft Kids e-readers to their lowest prices ever
• All of the kid-friendly Kindles have 16GB of storage and are ad-free

items.title: Keychron mechanical keyboards are up to 62 percent off
bullets: • Keychron mechanical keyboards are up to 62 percent off at Woot
• The company is one of the biggest names in mechanical keyboards
• Woot has great deals running on a fleet of wired and wireless models, some of which have hot-swappable switches

items.title: OpenAI’s parental controls are out — here’s what you should know
bullets: • Parents must have their own accounts to access the controls
• Teens must opt in, either by inviting a parent to link their account or by accepting a parent’s invitation
• Parents don’t have access to their teens’ conversations, even with a linked account

items.title: GameSir’s clip-on controller turns smartphones into Game Boys
bullets: • The accessory hasn’t been officially announced but the company recently demonstrated it at the Tokyo Game Show
• The C-shaped accessory slides on to the bottom of a smartphone and features a D-pad, Start and Select buttons that are styled after the Game Boy’s

items.title: CNN Political Briefing
bullets: • CNN Political Director David Chalian takes you inside the latest developments with insight and analysis from the key players in politics
• Suzan DelBene (D-WA) is laser-focused on re-capturing the House in 2026
• The race for New Jersey governor could be the sleeper contest of the year

items.title: The Axe Files with David Axelrod
bullets: • The Axe Files with David Axelrod is a series of revealing interviews with key figures in the political world
• This week marks the final episode of the series of interviews with Axelrod's friend, US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel
• Scott Jennings is well known as a conservative firebrand on CNN
